questions.question_text: Which three statements about IPv6 prefixes are true? (Choose three.)

choices.C: FE80::/8 is used for link-local unicast.
choices.A: FEC0::/10 is used for IPv6 broadcast.
choices.F: FF00::/8 is used for IPv6 multicast.
choices.D: FE80::/10 is used for link-local unicast.
choices.B: FC00::/7 is used in private networks.

discussion.content:
0000-00FF - Logical interface address, any address, an unspecified address, or an IPv4-compatible address
2000-3FFF - Global unicast address (routable address in the range of addresses that are currently distributed by the Administration of the Internet Address Space [IANA])
FE80-FEBF | FE80::X /10 - Local channel address (unicast address identifying the host computer in the local network)
FC00-FCFF-A unique local address (a unicast address that can be assigned to a node to identify it as part of a specific subnet in the local network)
FF00-FFFF | FF00::/8 | FF02::1 (All Nodes) - Multicast
::1 - ipv6 Loopback
FF02:0:0:0:0:1:FF00::/104 - Solicited Node

Selected Answer: BDF
FE80::/10 is used for link-local unicast.

The show ip dhcp conflict command displays all address conflicts registered by the DHCP server. The server uses command ping to attract clients. To equip conjugates, the wedge uses an ARP tokol. If an address conflict is detected, the address is removed from the pool and not assigned until the administrator resolves the conflict.

It looks like this:

Router# shows ip dhcp conflict
Method of determining the IP address Detection time
192.168.1.33 Ping February 19, 2018, 10:33
192.168.1.48 Gratuitous ARP February 19, 2018, 11:29

Selected Answer: A
show ip dhcp conflict 10.0.2.12

choices.D: Leased lines provide highly flexible bandwidth scaling.
choices.A: Leased lines provide inexpensive WAN access.
choices.E: Multiple leased lines can share a router interface.
choices.F: Leased lines support up to T1 link speeds.
choices.B: Leased lines with sufficient bandwidth can avoid latency between endpoints.
choices.C: Leased lines require little installation and maintenance expertise.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about using leased lines for your WAN infrastructure are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
The advantages of leased lines include:
+ Simplicity: Point-to-point communication links require minimal expertise to install and maintain. So Answer C: Leased lines require little installation and maintenance expertise IS CORRECT !!!

+ Quality: Point-to-point communication links usually offer high service quality, if they have adequate bandwidth.
The dedicated capacity removes latency or jitter between the endpoints. So Answer B: Leased lines with sufficient bandwidth can avoid latency between endpoints IS CORRECT!!!!!

The disadvantages of leased lines include:
+ Limited flexibility: WAN traffic is often variable, and leased lines have a fixed capacity, so the bandwidth of the line seldom matches the need exactly, therefore answer D IS NOT CORRECT.

Additionally, any change to the leased line generally requires a site visit by ISP personnel to adjust capacity.

Selected Answer: CD
C. Leased lines require little installation and maintenance expertise.
D. Leased lines provide highly flexible bandwidth scaling
